{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3377893,"name":"Phil Szymanowski","username":"Cyberphil","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cyberphil/{size}/161083_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-01T12:19:31.784Z","cooked":"

Hey all!

The MKCAD team is gearing up for updating and improving the library for the 2025 season. Just like the past few competition years, this thread is the place where you can post any requests or fixes for components or assemblies, additional features, or any issues you have had while using the library or app.

Trello

We have a public Trello board with the list of open items that have already been requested or completed. It’s a bit messy following the business of build and competition season, but we’re hoping to trim it down before the 2025 season.

Before you make a request, please take a look on the Trello to see if your request is already in there or in-progress. Over the next few months we plan to develop a priority order so the most used and requested components and features can get the most attention.

Document Structure

The structure that we landed on last year seems to be working well, so it will remain as is. You should see no structural changes to the library, only cleaning up and organization of the current structure.

There is a request to work in subcategories that are driven by the folders in each document into the app, but as far as I know the featurescript library currently has no ability to navigate the folders in such a way.

Joining the MKCAD Team

We’re a relatively small group of alumni and mentors who are continuously more and more busy. Any and all help would be welcomed!
On that note, we are considering some ways to get students involved, but for the safety of all parties and to maintain compliance with YPP we will not be accepting active students or minors onto the MKCAD team for the time being. If you are interested in joining the team, please send a DM to some combination of at least two of myself, @RickyRobot, @Ty_Tremblay, or @AndrewCard.

This is a bit of a tricky situation. If we decide to copy the featurescript you are mentioning we break the connection to any updates it would get in the future by the developer who has no connection to MKCAD. We could then add our own features, but I don’t like the idea of making one specific for our uses at the featurescript level.

In my opinion, a better option for this would be to insert the gear you want as a featurescript into your part studio and then make any changes you wish to see to it, like FRC-specific bore options, or mounting hole patterns.

We could do this as a separate configurable part in MKCAD as well, it’s just that there are just so many configuration options at that point. It likely won’t be hard to break with the right inputs.

IDK if it is user error, but I often find a much more complete library in the MKCad docs then I do in the MKCad app. My request is to sync these automatically or have a more rigorous process to ensure updates are carried through.

Another request is that occasionally, it is helpful to derive a component from an assembly into a part studio for modification. This may be a single part or a cluster of parts that should come in as a unit. The MKCad app doesn’t allow for parts that only exist in an assembly (think Gearbox Plate) to be easily derived.

Lastly, it would be really nice to have the ability to search by vendor and part number in the App.

Request: mate connectors default to hidden.

Another “…or is this user error” item. The configurable Thunderhex (and some other parts/assemblies) comes with a visible mate connector on each end. If you select the part and hit “hide mates” these do not disappear. I need to click on the part in the feature tree (or instances list) go to its drop down, then click on the hide icon.

I just updated a large assembly and every single hex shaft now has visible mates that need to be manually hidden. Again, unless I’m doing something wrong.

Defaulting to hidden mate connectors is generally on the user side. Some documents have the ability to include or remove mate connectors entirely, but we don’t have control of whether they are shown or hidden from the document side.

Remember that mates and mate connectors are two different things, and you can hide and show both with a shortcut.

Some of our documents have a checkbox configuration input that says something like “Include mate connectors.” If this is unchecked, there will be no pre-made mate connectors on the part/assembly.

If you hit hide mates you aren’t doing anything to the mate connectors and vice versa.

It is a bit confusing, so here is how I think of the two:

Mate connectors are the coordinate systems related to each part that tell you where to align them.

Mates, on the other hand, describe how those coordinate systems interact; whether they are stationary (Fastened), rotate about their Z axes (Revolute), linearly move about their Z axes (Slider) etc.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":131,"updated_at":"2024-05-01T15:49:27.526Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":642,"readers_count":641,"score":148.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":465041,"topic_slug":"mkcad-2024-post-season-feedback-and-requests","display_username":"Phil Szymanowski","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14980,"username":"Zook","name":"Tom","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zook/{size}/252720_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10874,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 272 (Cyber Crusaders), FTC 23598 (Robotic Pretzles)"},"post_url":"/t/mkcad-2024-post-season-feedback-and-requests/465041/6","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378000,"name":"Phil Szymanowski","username":"Cyberphil","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cyberphil/{size}/161083_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-01T15:55:31.609Z","cooked":"

This isn’t user error, this is purposeful. MKCAD contributors can choose what exists on the app and what doesn’t. There are certain items that, for whatever reason, we don’t want to show in the app. Sometimes this is depreciated parts from vendors, or old models that we have made replacements for, or other situations.

There are probably more than a few things that should be in the app that were never updated to show there. If you see something specific just let us know and we can put it in the app.

The MKCAD app probably isn’t where you would want to pull those individual components. They exist in a part studio somewhere, but we opt to hide them from the app as it prevents clutter. We do our best to keep things neat for the less experienced users. The best way to bring in those parts would be to insert through the regular Onshape insert interface which shows everything in MKCAD.

Searching by vendor should be as easy as putting the part prefix in. For example, TTB, AM, or REV. The search only searches the title of the document, not any of the metadata, so the configurable items that contain parts from different vendors are not searchable in this way. Not sure if this is something that we can accomplish, but I really like the idea.

As someone who works on a Chromebook from time to time I noticed that the Versa Planetary assembly has a lot of extra Primitives that increase loading time. So I made a simplified version linked below that reduces the number of Primitives by over a order of magnitude, it would be cool if this could be added to MkCAD.

cad.onshape.com

Onshape

Sign in to Onshape, the #1 fastest growing CAD system in the world with over 4 million users.

Also, I am a graduating senior. So next year if you need any help I am open to helping a little here and there.

Also, thanks a ton for making this tool available. We would not have been able to build the robot we built and go to worlds without this tool.

After reviewing with the team and reflecting on my own additions to the library that are now not in the app it seems like your hunch is a genuine problem. Parts are occasionally being removed from the app and require us to manually add them again. I thought this was an MKCAD contributer error, but I don’t think it is.

We’ve asked @dydx to take a look to see if something is going on. She added some logging logic to track how and when the parts are being removed from the app. We will be monitoring this in the hopes of finding a fix

Thanks for the mention, and apologies for the somewhat dismissive response I had.

Cyberphil:

The search only searches the title of the document, not any of the metadata, so the configurable items that contain parts from different vendors are not searchable in this way.

I guess my request is for the items that are common, like bearings, we add the vendor to the meta-data and support that search. This can be a bit weird because the MKCad app/tool has biases towards certain vendors for certain items. For example, configurable bearings are based around Vex offerings, but that is not a complete set. We also have some redundancy for configurable components that are close, but not identical.

Cyberphil:

The best way to bring in those parts would be to insert through the regular Onshape insert interface which shows everything in MKCAD.

Could there be a power-user check box that shows everything? It is so much faster to use the app than go find things in the Back-end.

Another Request:
Could all wheels of a given OD/hub type be under a single configurable component? Or even better, just make a single “Configurable wheel” that has the user specify the Hub style and OD, then has a list of options?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":131,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T15:24:59.800Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":494,"readers_count":493,"score":103.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":465041,"topic_slug":"mkcad-2024-post-season-feedback-and-requests","display_username":"Dan_Karol","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7133,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"131 CHAOS"},"post_url":"/t/mkcad-2024-post-season-feedback-and-requests/465041/10","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378845,"name":"Phil Szymanowski","username":"Cyberphil","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cyberphil/{size}/161083_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T17:02:39.948Z","cooked":"
Dan_Karol:

I guess my request is for the items that are common, like bearings, we add the vendor to the meta-data and support that search.

I believe we can configure the vendor data to let users choose where they want their bearings from if they are common items. I will add that to the list.

The metadata search in the app is above my involvement in the app. I will add it to the Trello to get the conversation going.

Dan_Karol:

Could there be a power-user check box that shows everything? It is so much faster to use the app than go find things in the Back-end.

It’s so funny to hear how other people use the system. I use the standard insert most of the time which is why I didn’t notice this at first.

A super-user option might be a good way to address this. There is already a separate user level for the contributors that shows everything and gives us the option to hide or show it from the app for standard users. I don’t want to speak for @dydx, but this seems feasible.

Dan_Karol:

Could all wheels of a given OD/hub type be under a single configurable component? Or even better, just make a single “Configurable wheel” that has the user specify the Hub style and OD, then has a list of options?

This is something that is possible. The issue with applying it to all wheels is there are different configuration options for different wheels. In order to make this work we would need to include all of the configuration options for all wheels in this “Master” wheel. Depending on the major wheel you choose, some percentage of the configuration options won’t be relevant but still selectable. We cannot configure configuration settings yet, but that might be a feature of Onshape in the future.

I see the possibility of inserting one master wheel part that contains every wheel from every vendor. This will make the configurable part incredibly difficult to work with and require many, many different configuration changes for the MKCAD team every time you want to add a wheel to the list, but it would make it easier for the user.

Until we can configure the visibility of other configuration variables I think this will be a worse experience for the users and more difficult for the maintainers.

Cyberphil:

A super-user option might be a good way to address this. There is already a separate user level for the contributors that shows everything and gives us the option to hide or show it from the app for standard users. I don’t want to speak for @dydx, but this seems feasible.

This is feasible, though it would take a bit of effort to rearchitect how items are updated and stored in the database. I disagree with it generally on a usability standpoint- the goal is to provide a streamlined experience and removing the ability to curate which parts are visible seems like the wrong direction, even if it’s optional. I would rather provide tools or improve the existing processes to make sure the library curation is the best it can be, like automatic version updating or a better management interface.

Curation is a difficult balance. We could make every part and studio visible, but that makes it little better than the native interface- maybe a bit faster and with better search.

I’m also trying to track down a bug where parts that are intended to be displayed are not, so it may be that some of the parts you’re looking for are accidentally not there instead of intentionally.

Dan_Karol:

Lastly, it would be really nice to have the ability to search by vendor and part number in the App.

I’ve lodged myself a ticket to implement this.
